result.execSummary:
The defendant Wesley S Conkle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid thru incarceration or extended supervision.  Not to collect more than 50% of defendant's income.  Failure to pay will be a civil judgment.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid thru incarceration or extended supervision.  Not to collect more than 50% of defendant's income.  Failure to pay will be a civil judgment.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

No illegal substances.
Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

Must follow rules of extended supervision.
Must provide a DNA sample.
***Per Amendment to Judgment of Conviction on 10/9/2019, no restitution claim was received from victim.***
